headline: Citing ‘Bad Faith,’ Flynn Asks to Take Back His Guilty Plea
abstract: Once cited by the special counsel team as an exemplary cooperating witness, Mr. Flynn had grown increasingly combative in recent months.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s former national security adviser Michael T. Flynn moved late on Tuesday to withdraw his guilty plea on charges of lying to investigators in the Russia inquiry, accusing prosecutors of “bad faith” and vindictiveness after they asked a judge to sentence him to prison for backing out of a deal to cooperate with them.
keywords: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates
